title: Structure for Informatica-EDC-REST-API-Samples' main configuration file
description: List all available configuration items for the main configuration file.

meta_version.description: the meta structure version for the object

schema_directory.description: The relative or absolute path to the JSON schema files. Add a trailing slash! Omit the version (will be added automatically).

json_directory.description: The relative or absolute path to the JSON files that need to be processed. Add a trailing slash!

output_directory.description: The entity structures will be written to this directory. Can be a relative or absolute path. Include a trailing slash!

target.description: Where to write the entity structure files to. (In the current version only 'local' has been implemented)

metadata_store.description: Where the information should be send to. (In the current version only 'edc' has been implemented)

edc_config.description: Relative or absolute path to the EDC configuration file that stores the information about the EDC source and target resource (scanned data objects)

edc_secrets.description: File that contains EDC connectivity information like EDC URL, encoded Authentication header.

jinja_config.description: Relative or absolute path to the configuration file that specifies the location where to find the Jinja2 templates

suppress_edc_call.description: Whether the actual call to EDC should be suppressed (True) or not (False). Default is False. Can be used as a dry-run.

http_proxy.description: HTTP Proxy to be used for EDC calls (if any). Can be set to "None"

https_proxy.description: HTTPS Proxy to be used for EDC calls (if any). Can be set to "None"

log_config.description: Relative or absolute path to the log configuration file (log location, logfile naming and more)
